data.wafr_pillar_prompt:
Please answer the following questions for the Operational Excellence pillar of the Well-Architected Framework Review (WAFR).
Questions:
OPS 1: How do you determine what your priorities are?
OPS 2: How do you structure your organization to support your business outcomes?
OPS 3: How does your organizational culture support your business outcomes?
OPS 4: How do you implement observability in your workload?
OPS 5: How do you reduce defects, ease remediation, and improve flow into production?
OPS 6: How do you mitigate deployment risks?
OPS 7: How do you know that you are ready to support a workload?
OPS 8: How do you utilize workload observability in your organization?
OPS 9: How do you understand the health of your operations?
OPS 10: How do you manage workload and operations events?
OPS 11: How do you evolve operations?

Please answer the following questions for the Security pillar of the Well-Architected Framework Review (WAFR).
Questions:
SEC 1: How do you securely operate your workload?
SEC 2: How do you manage identities for people and machines?
SEC 3: How do you manage permissions for people and machines?
SEC 4: How do you detect and investigate security events?
SEC 5: How do you protect your network resources?
SEC 6: How do you protect your compute resources?
SEC 7: How do you classify your data?
SEC 8: How do you protect your data at rest?
SEC 9: How do you protect your data in transit?
SEC 10: How do you anticipate, respond to, and recover from incidents?
SEC 11: How do you incorporate and validate the security properties of applications throughout the design, development, and deployment lifecycle?

Please answer the following questions for the Reliability pillar of the Well-Architected Framework Review (WAFR).
Questions:
REL 1: How do you manage service quotas and constraints?
REL 2: How do you plan your network topology?
REL 3: How do you design your workload service architecture?
REL 4: How do you design interactions in a distributed system to prevent failures?
REL 5: How do you design interactions in a distributed system to mitigate or withstand failures?
REL 6: How do you monitor workload resources?
REL 7: How do you design your workload to adapt to changes in demand?
REL 8: How do you implement change?
REL 9: How do you back up data?
REL 10: How do you use fault isolation to protect your workload?
REL 11: How do you design your workload to withstand component failures?
REL 12: How do you test reliability?
REL 13: How do you plan for disaster recovery (DR)?

Please answer the following questions for the Performance efficiency pillar of the Well-Architected Framework Review (WAFR).
Questions:
PERF 1: How do you select the appropriate cloud resources and architecture patterns for your workload?
PERF 2: How do you select and use compute resources in your workload?
PERF 3: How do you store, manage, and access data in your workload?
PERF 4: How do you select and configure networking resources in your workload?
PERF 5: What process do you use to support more performance efficiency for your workload?

Please answer the following questions for the Cost Optimization pillar of the Well-Architected Framework Review (WAFR).
Questions:
COST 1: How do you implement cloud financial management?
COST 2: How do you govern usage?
COST 3: How do you monitor your cost and usage?
COST 4: How do you decommission resources?
COST 5: How do you evaluate cost when you select services?
COST 6: How do you meet cost targets when you select resource type, size and number?
COST 7: How do you use pricing models to reduce cost?
COST 8: How do you plan for data transfer charges?
COST 9: How do you manage demand, and supply resources?
COST 10: How do you evaluate new services?
COST 11: How do you evaluate the cost of effort?

Please answer the following questions for the Sustainability pillar of the Well-Architected Framework Review (WAFR).
Questions:
SUS 1: How do you select Regions for your workload?
SUS 2: How do you align cloud resources to your demand?
SUS 3: How do you take advantage of software and architecture patterns to support your sustainability goals?
SUS 4: How do you take advantage of data management policies and patterns to support your sustainability goals?
SUS 5: How do you select and use cloud hardware and services in your architecture to support your sustainability goals?
SUS 6: How do your organizational processes support your sustainability goals?

Please answer the following questions for the Operational Excellence pillar of Well-Architected Framework Review (WAFR) Data Analytics Lens Lens.
Questions:
OPS 1: How do you measure the health of your analytics workload?
OPS 2: How do you deploy jobs and applications in a controlled and reproducible way?

Please answer the following questions for the Security pillar of Well-Architected Framework Review (WAFR) Data Analytics Lens Lens.
Questions:
SEC 1: How do you protect data in your organizations analytics workload?
SEC 2: How do you manage access to data within your organization's source, analytics, and downstream systems?
SEC 3: How do you protect the infrastructure of the analytics workload?

Please answer the following questions for the Reliability pillar of Well-Architected Framework Review (WAFR) Data Analytics Lens Lens.
Questions:
REL 1: How do you design analytics workloads to withstand and mitigate failures?
REL 2: How do you govern data and metadata changes?

Please answer the following questions for the Performance Efficiency pillar of Well-Architected Framework Review (WAFR) Data Analytics Lens Lens.
Questions
PERF 1: How do you select the best-performing options for your analytics workload?
PERF 2: How do you select the best-performing storage options for your workload?
PERF 3: How do you select the best-performing file formats and partitioning?

Please answer the following questions for the Cost Optimization pillar of Well-Architected Framework Review (WAFR) Data Analytics Lens Lens.
Questions:
COST 1: How do you select the compute and storage solution for your analytics workload?
COST 2: How do you measure and attribute the analytics workload financial accountability?
COST 3: How do you manage the cost of your workload over time?
COST 4: How do you choose the financially-optimal pricing models of the infrastructure?

Please answer the following questions for the Sustainability pillar of Well-Architected Framework Review (WAFR) Data Analytics Lens Lens.
Questions:
SUS 1: How does your organization measure and improve its sustainability practices?

Please answer the following questions for the Operational Excellence pillar of the Well-Architected Framework Review (WAFR).
Questions:
OPS 1: Have you defined risk management roles for the cloud?
OPS 2: Have you completed an operational risk assessment?
OPS 3: Have you assessed your specific workload against regulatory needs?
OPS 4: How do you assess your ability to operate a workload in the cloud?
OPS 5: How do you understand the health of your workload?
OPS 6: How do you assess the business impact of a cloud provider service event?
OPS 7: Have you developed a continuous improvement model?

Please answer the following questions for the Security pillar of Well-Architected Framework Review (WAFR) Financial Services Industry Lens Lens.
Questions:
SEC 1: How does your governance enable secure cloud adoption at scale?
SEC 2: How do you achieve, maintain, and monitor ongoing compliance with regulatory guidelines and mandates?
SEC 3: How do you monitor the use of elevated credentials, such as administrative accounts, and guard against privilege escalation?
SEC 4: How do you accommodate separation of duties as part of your identity and access management design?
SEC 5: How are you monitoring your ongoing cloud environment for potential threats?
SEC 6: How do you address emerging threats?
SEC 7: How are you inspecting your financial services infrastructure and network for unauthorized traffic?
SEC 8: How do you isolate your software development lifecycle (SDLC) environments (like development, test, and production)?
SEC 9: How are you managing your encryption keys?
SEC 10: How are you handling data loss prevention in the cloud environment?
SEC 11: How are you protecting against ransomware?
SEC 12: How are you meeting your obligations for incident reporting to regulators?

Please answer the following questions for the Reliability pillar of Well-Architected Framework Review (WAFR) Financial Services Industry Lens Lens.
Questions:
REL 1: Have you planned for events that impact your software development infrastructure and challenge your recovery & resolution plans?
REL 2: Are you practicing continuous resilience to ensure that your services meet regulatory availability and recovery requirements?
REL 3: How are your business and regulatory requirements driving the resilience of your workload?
REL 4: Does the resilience and the architecture of your workload reflect the business requirements and resilience tier?
REL 5: Is the resilience of the architecture addressing challenges for distributed workloads across AWS and an external entity?
REL 6: To mitigate operational risks, can your workload owners detect, locate, and recover from gray failures?
REL 7: How do you monitor your resilience objectives to achieve your strategic objectives and business plan?
REL 8: How do you monitor your resources to understand your workloads health?
REL 9: How are you backing up data in the cloud?
REL 10: How are backups retained?

Please answer the following questions for the Performance Efficiency pillar of Well-Architected Framework Review (WAFR) Financial Services Industry Lens Lens.
Questions:
PERF 1: How do you select the best performing architecture?
PERF 2: How do you select your compute architecture?
PERF 3: How do you select your storage architecture?
PERF 4: How do you select your network architecture?
PERF 5: How do you evaluate compliance with performance requirements?
PERF 6: How do you make trade-offs in your architecture?

Please answer the following questions for the Cost Optimization pillar of the Well-Architected Framework Review (WAFR) Financial Services Industry Lens Lens.
Questions:
COST 1: Is your cloud team educated on relevant technical and commercial optimization mechanisms?
COST 2: Do you apply the Pareto-principle (80/20 rule) to manage, optimize, and plan your cloud usage and spend?
COST 3: Do you use automation to drive scale for Cloud Financial Management practices?
COST 4: How do you promote cost-awareness within your organization?
COST 5: How do you track anomalies in your ongoing costs for AWS services?
COST 6: How do you track your workload usage cycles?
COST 7: Are you using all the available AWS credit and investment programs?
COST 8: Are you monitoring usage of Savings Plans regularly?
COST 9: Are you using the cost advantages of tiered storage?
COST 10: Do you use lower cost Regions to run less data-intensive or time-sensitive workloads?
COST 11: Do you use cost tradeoffs of various AWS pricing models in your workload design?
COST 12: Are you saving costs by adopting a set of modern microservice architectures?
COST 13: Do you use cloud services to accommodate consulting or testing of projects?
COST 14: How do you measure the cost of licensing third-party applications and software?
COST 15: Have you reviewed your ongoing cost structure tradeoffs for your current AWS services lately?
COST 16: Are you continuously assessing the ongoing costs and usage of your cloud implementations?
COST 17: Are you continually reviewing your workload to provide the most cost-effective resources?
COST 18: Do you have specific workload modernization or refactoring goals in your cloud strategy?
COST 19: Do you use the cloud to drive innovation & operational excellence of your business model to impact both the top & bottom line?

Please answer the following questions for the Sustainability pillar of Well-Architected Framework Review (WAFR) Financial Services Industry Lens Lens.
Questions:
SUS 1: How do you select the most sustainable Regions in your area?
SUS 2: How do you address data sovereignty regulations for location of sustainable Region?
SUS 3: How do you select a Region to optimize financial services workloads for sustainability?
SUS 4: How do you prioritize business critical functions over non-critical functions?
SUS 5: How do you define, review, and optimize network access patterns for sustainability?
SUS 6: How do you monitor and minimize resource usage for financial services workloads?
SUS 7: How do you optimize batch processing components for sustainability?
SUS 8: How do you optimize your resource usage?
SUS 9: How do you optimize areas of your code that use the most resources?
SUS 10: Have you selected the storage class with the lowest carbon footprint?
SUS 11: Do you store processed data or raw data?
SUS 12: What is your process for benchmarking instances for existing workloads?
SUS 13: Can you complete workloads over more time while not violating your maximum SLA?
SUS 14: Do you have multi-architecture images for grid computing systems?
SUS 15: What is your testing process for workloads that require floating point precision?
SUS 16: Do you achieve a judicious use of development resources?
SUS 17: How do you minimize your test, staging, sandbox instances?
SUS 18: How do you define the minimum requirement in response time for customers in order to maximize your green SLA?
